intro: Clibadium eggersii, commonly known as the African snakeweed, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in a cluster, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a rough texture. Clibadium eggersii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
